title: Handle remote peers not having block requested by root
body:
### Description
When a remote peer doesn't have the block requested by root, it should return no response chunks.  Teku however is expecting it to always return a single chunk.

We should fix this to return an empty `Optional` to indicate the peer does not have the block and cleanly handle that case, rather than throwing an exception.

Note the error is logged at DEBUG level so it's not noise in logs but is incorrect behaviour.
